description: It's the Demon versus...Lobo! Need we say more?
name: Apocolypse Now! 4 Behold a Pale Rider

description: Special guest star Lobo and Etrigan are caught by the Odd Squad, the Witch Boy Klarion's grisly gang, in the heart of a nuclear storage facility. What could be weirder than Lobo getting his hands on a live H-bomb?
Klarion the Witch-Boy's screwy magic causes the Demon Etrigan and Jason Blood to switch bodies and fight each other in the mad dimension known as the Beyond Region!
name: The Region Beyond

description: War of the Gods Part 22. To the delight of DEMON fans, Wonder Woman gets killed. Klarion the Witch-Boy snatches her spirit and sends it to the Beyond Region where Jason Blood, inhabited by Etrigan, falls head-over-heels for the Amazon Princess.
Running from Wotan and the Wild Hunt in the Beyond Region, Jason Blood and the Demon turn to an unlikely source for help: the eternally miserable High Lord of the Realm, Scapegoat.

As the cover says, it's 'The Utterly Disgusting Secret Origin of the Demon Etrigan' in which Lord Scapegoat, ruler of the Beyond Region and Etrigan's younger brother, tells the story of the Demon's childhood. This issue also features a bound-in, totally gratuitous Lobo and Demon mini-poster.
name: Beyond Love Story

description: Etrigan confronts the dreaded Golden Knight in an effort to win the disgusting secret spell that permits exit from the Beyond Region.
name: Beyond the Battle-Cosmic! (Or words to that effect)

description: Jason and Etrigan finally meet face-to-face for the first time as they journey home to Gotham City from the freakish Beyond Region. But they are intercepted by the mysterious and omniscient Lurker, who fights them using Jason's old flame Glenda and the Demon's old enemy Lobo.
name: Pain! Death! Destruction! These Are a Few of My Favorite Things!

description: This special story, written and drawn by Matt Wagner, is an excellent entry point for new readers. In it, Etrigan finds himself the pawn in a mystical power struggle between two competing witches. As you might imagine, Etrigan has ideas of his own about being anyone's pawn.
name: Witch War

description: Part 1 of the 2-part 'The Return of the Howler.' Robin the Boy Wonder guest-stars as Etrigan and Jason Blood agree to work together for the first time. The Demon runs afoul of an ancient and malicious were-creature stalking the streets of Gotham City, which attracts the attention of Robin, as well. Continued next issue.
name: The Demon Vs. Robin the Boy Monster?!

description: Part 2 of the 2-part 'The Return of the Howler,' continued from the previous issue. The Demon Etrigan is on the trail in Gotham City of were-creatures known as the Howlers. When the Demon is captured, Batman and Robin must attempt a rescue with the help of a gun-toting Glenda Mark.

During the Black Plague, a Medieval judge was cursed to walk the Earth as an immortal. Now, 800 years later, he's out for blood - Jason Blood. But when Etrigan, the Demon is summoned, the judge may have met his match.
name: From Here to Eternity

description: Part 1 of the 4-part 'Political Asylum!' Just when things seem to have settled down for Jason Blood and Glenda, a horrifying presence rears its ugly head: American politics. Etrigan is asked to run for president by Darren Dingle, the 96-year-old founder of the American Liberty Institute.
name: Political Asylum!, Part 1: Damage Control

description: Part 2 of the 4-part 'Political Asylum!' The Demon Etrigan runs for President of the U.S., hoping he can then get his hands on a nuclear arsenal. Etrigan and his public relations staff spin-control and sound-bite their way to national popularity as Superman makes a special cameo appearance.
name: Political Asylum!, Part 2: "Etrigan, He's Our Man, If He Can't Do It, No One Can!"

description: Part 3 of the 4-part 'Political Asylum!' An assassin's bullet fails to kill presidential candidate Etrigan, and the Demon is out for blood. But the Demon's outrageous campaign practices have come to the attention of Superman.
name: Political Asylum!, Part 3: Spin Control

description: Etrigan's plan for political office goes off-kilter when he's offered the vice-presidental chair. He accepts and his political assistant realizes that he plans to eventually kill the President and take over the seat of power that way. The assistant uses her skills and inside knowledge to nuetralize Etrigan and destroy his Presidental aspirations. She goes into hiding but is swiftly found anyway. Etrigan does not hurt her, though. Her deviousness in destroying his plans are qualities he admires.
name: Political Asylum!, Part 4: Out of Control

description: From the blackest bowels of Hell springs Asteroth. But instead of trying to conquer Hell, this time he's coping with the horrors of working at a gas station for minimum wage.

Lobo guest-stars as Jason Blood learns he must return to Hell to retrieve the soul of the increasingly obnoxious Harry the Pillow. Jason knows that Etrigan is unable to roam Hell unescorted, so he summons the one man in the universe who can thwart Etrigan - Lobo!
Because you demanded it (and DC felt like it!)...the rematch between the Demon and Wonder Woman! Plus...Lobo's back for a major Demon/Lobo epic.

Lobo's back...and the Demon's got him! This time he isn't fooling around with any wimp nuclear bombs either, as Etrigan and the Main Man team to crush the archfiend Asteroth and his scoundrel pals, Tweedledee and Tweedledum, before heading off together on the road to Hell.
name: When Bastiches Clash!

description: Lobo returns to THE DEMON and the two take the highway to Hell as Etrigan's dad steals the soul of Harry the Pillow, leaving Harry acting like a real bastich.

Lobo guest-stars as Belial, Etrigan's father, refuses to restore the soul of Harry the Pillow, forcing Lobo and the Demon to try to retrieve the heart of Belial from an impenetrable fortress. They face the demons of Hell in Etrigan's cool new 'Demonmobile.'

Those two violent but lovable maniacs, the Demon and Lobo, stomp around the afterlife as they retrieve the torn-out heart of the archfiend Belial (Etrigan's dad), but not before Merlin the Magician (Etrigan's brother) causes a whole boatload of trouble for everyone involved.

Lobo licks his wounds and Morax the Bull-Beast of Stygia doesn't believe that Thing-That-Cannot-Die cannot die. Meanwhile, Etrigan attempts to cast a spell to recreate his father's heart. When the two angels ruling Hell try to stop the process, Etrigan, Lobo and Morax challenge the angels to a free-for-all tag-team wrestling match.

To fulfill the terms of their quest, Lobo, Etrigan and Morax must secure the heart of Belial...which, unfortunately, has been eaten by the Thing-That-Cannot-Die. The only logical solution is to create a new heart for Etrigan's dad...by slaughtering 10,000 demons!
name: Meet the Bastiches

description: Lobo guest-stars. Now that Harry's soul has been restored, it's up to Etrigan and Lobo to put an end to Merlin's despicable plan, in the final showdown between Merlin and the Demon in Hell.
name: I Did It My Way!

description: The Demon embarks on a new and darker direction with writer Garth Ennis, as black-leather biker Johnny Basterson summons up one of Etrigan's old pals to desecrate some holy ground and raise some hell! But the Demon has his own ideas.
name: The Wild One

description: It's a look back to the life of Jason Blood during the Dark Ages as he is kidnapped and brought to the Holy Land by a mad bishop during the Crusades. But the bishop has designs on the power of the Demon, and Etrigan's twisted sense of humor and justice wreaks havoc with the bishop's plans to storm the Castle of the Damned.
name: Castle of the Damned

description: Etrigan is appointed Hell's Hitman by the realm's angelic masters. Etrigan is charged with searching out and destroying other earthbound demons...but the angels aren't quite prepared for his enthusiasm!
name: Hell's Hitman, Part One: Fall and Rise!

description: In his newly-appointed position of Hell's enforcer, Etrigan enlists the aid of Hitman, the New Blood created in Demon (1990) Annual #2...but the Demon isn't quite prepared to deal with the infernal mob lord Asteroth, who enlists his own help in the form of the Choirboy Commandos.
name: Hell's Hitman, Part Two: Cry Havoc!

description: Reprint of Tales to Astonish #96
name: Somewhere Stands... Skull Island!/ What Have I Created?

description: Reprint from Tales to Astonish #97
name: The Sovereign And The Savages/ The Legions Of: The Living Lightning

description: Reprint of Tales to Astonish #98
name: ...To Destroy The Realm Eternal!/ The Puppet And The Power!

description: Reprint of Tales to Astonish #99
name: When The Monster Wakes!/ When Falls The Holocaust!

description: Reprint of Tales to Astonish #101
name: Where Walk The Immortals!/ ...And Evil Shall Beckon!
Ring Around the Rhino!
This Monster Unleashed!
Above the Earth - a Titan Rages!
Ten Rings Hath the Mandarin!
Monster Triumphant!
The Monster and the Man-Beast!
Umbu the Unliving!
Shanghaied in Space!

description: This issue reprints Hulk 112.
name: The Brute Battles On!
Where Fall The Shifting Sands?
At the Mercy of Maximus the Mad!
On The Side of The Evil Inhumans
The Monster and the Murder Module!

description: This is a reprint of Incredible Hulk (1st series) #126.
name: ...Where Stalks The Night-Crawler
And In This Corner... The Avengers!
In the Shadow of the Golem
Add Them All Together--They Spell Death!
If America is to Live--The Hulk Must Die!
The Girl in the Emerald Atom!
I, the Inheritor!
Cry Hulk! Cry Havok!
But Who Will Judge the Hulk?
The World, My Jury
Hell Is a Very Small Hulk!

description: Reprint from The Incredible Hulk 155.
name: Destination: Nightmare!

description: Reprints The Incredible Hulk #157
name: Name My Vengeance: Rhino

description: Batman--Aterkomsten is actully the spanish version of the comic adapation of the film Batman Returns.
